official_title: To require the advance disclosure to shareholders of certain executive pension plans.

summary.text: Corporate Advance Disclosure Act of 2004 - Amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to require that: (1) an issuer provide to the Securities and Exchange Commission 60 days notice in advance of any action that creates, substantially increases, or funds a non-qualified pension plan for which any director or executive officer of the issuer is the beneficiary; and (2) the notice separately state each creation, increase, or funding with respect to each such director or officer.

titles.title: To require the advance disclosure to shareholders of certain executive pension plans.
